thread.title: Daveigh Chase 'left dying man outside LA hospital'
thread.title_full: Daveigh Chase 'left dying man outside LA hospital'

title: Daveigh Chase 'left dying man outside LA hospital'
text: comments Daveigh Chase, child star of 2002 horror movie The Ring, was arrested by LAPD detectives after she allegedly left a dying man outside a hospital. Chase, now 26, had reportedly been hanging out with the man in the early hours of February 15, before she left him at the hospital's front door and fled. Police then ran her name and discovered an outstanding warrant out against her, leading to her arrest on Wednesday, TMZ reported. Daveigh Chase (left in 2012) was arrested on an outstanding traffic warrant after leaving a dying man at a hospital. She isn't a suspect. She was a ghost in 2002's The Ring (right) The man was pronounced dead after being found by hospital staff. Chase is not a suspect in the man's death, which is being treated as a possible overdose, police said. The actress, whose arrest was due to an unrelated misdemeanor traffic warrant, says she was only trying to get the victim to the hospital. Chase played the ghostly Samara Morgan in The Ring, a remake of the Japanese horror movie Ringu, winning 'Best Villain' for the role in the 2003 MTV awards. She also had a recurring role in HBO's Mormon drama Big Love as child bride Rhonda Volmer, and also voiced the character of Lilo in the Disney animation Lilo & Stitch. Her breakout role was as Sarah Darko, younger sister of Donnie Darko in 2001 teen drama/horror movie Donnie Darko. She reprised the role in 2009 sequel S. Darko. The LAPD has declined to give any further details. RELATED ARTICLES
